conclusion: Trying to find the maximum value of the electromotive force (EMF) generated by the AC generator.
Figure shows a rotating-armature AC generator with a rectangular coil rotating uniformly around an axis perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field.
The coil has 100 turns and a resistance of 10 ohms, connected to a resistor R of 90 ohms via slip rings, with an ideal voltmeter connected in parallel with R.
Graph shows magnetic flux Φ through each turn of the coil varies sinusoidally with time t, oscillating between -2.0 × 10^-2 Wb and 2.0 × 10^-2 Wb.
At time t=0, the plane of the coil is parallel to the direction of the magnetic field, indicating maximum flux position.
Need to find the maximum value of the EMF generated by the AC generator.
Recall that EMF is generated in a rotating coil in a magnetic field by the rate of change of magnetic flux through the coil.
General formula for induced EMF in a rotating coil: ε = -N * dΦ/dt.
Since the coil is rotating uniformly, the magnetic flux through it varies sinusoidally with time.
At t=0, the coil is parallel to the magnetic field, corresponding to maximum flux position.
At t=0, Φ = 2.0 × 10^-2 Wb, decreasing to zero at t=3.14×10^-2 s, then becomes negative.
Flux varies sinusoidally, and EMF is the derivative of this flux with respect to time.
Find expression for Φ as a function of time: amplitude of flux is 2.0 × 10^-2 Wb, period T is 6.28 × 10^-2 s.
Angular frequency ω is 2π/T, calculated as ω = 100 rad/s.
Flux can be expressed as Φ(t) = Φ_max * cos(ωt), matching initial condition at t=0.
Expression for flux: Φ(t) = 2.0×10^-2 * cos(100t) Wb.
EMF ε is minus N times dΦ/dt, calculated as ε = 2000 * sin(100t) V.
